content.prompt: After Lilaâ€™s musings about the pelicans, the sentence at the end of the second paragraph has which effect?

choices.label: It suggests that she may actually know the answers to many of the questions she poses about the pelicans.
It undercuts the poetic description of the pelicans to reveal that she thinks of them primarily as an alibi.
It summarizes how her attitude toward the pelicans changed after she learned more about them.
It indicates that she feels more affection for the old man than her previous actions in the passage have suggested.

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Explain the function of a particular sequence of events in a plot.
